Event:

He accused me of ignoring him and said that he never wanted to go outside with me during our Christmas celebration. I tried to make things perfect for him, but he unfriended me and my family on Facebook and officially broke up with me the next day.

Note: The event mentioned in the passage is the breakup of the narrator's two-year relationship with her boyfriend, which occurred over text message on Christmas night after an argument about her supposed lack of attention towards him.
Post: "Despite my best efforts to make our relationship work, he unceremoniously ended things via a cold, impersonal message. It's like I was disposable and could be cast aside without a second thought. #HeWasNeverTheOne #LessonLearned"

Event:
* Having a difficult life
* Living in unending pain every day
* Nearly breaking down at work due to stress
* Quitting job due to incorrect pay and hours
* Taking care of sick father
* Having a lump in breast, but being cancer-free
* Deteriorating mother's health
* No one to help with caring for sick father
* Oldest brother having heart problems
* Middle brother not showing interest in family affairs
* Feeling overwhelmed and unable to handle life
* Having suicidal thoughts and feelings.
Post:
"Despite my best efforts, it seems like the universe is conspiring against me. Everything I do, everything I am, feels like it's not enough."
2. Event: Living in unending pain every day
IAS Post: "Pain is my constant companion, always there to remind me of my limitations and the fragility of life."
3. Event: Nearly breaking down at work due to stress
IAS Post: "Why do I always have to be the one to hold it together? Why can't anyone else understand just how much this is weighing on me?"
4. Event: Quitting job due to incorrect pay and hours
IAS Post: "It's not fair that I have to sacrifice my well-being for a job that doesn't value me. I should be treated with respect and compensated fairly, but instead I'm just another cog in the machine."
5. Event: Taking care of sick father
IAS Post: "Why did this have to happen to me? Why do I have to be the one responsible for someone else's well-being? It feels like I'm drowning under the weight of it all."
6. Event: Having a lump in breast, but being cancer-free
IAS Post: "I should be grateful that I don't have cancer, but instead I'm consumed by this constant worry and fear. Why can't I just enjoy life without always feeling on edge?"
7. Event: Deteriorating mother's health
IAS Post: "Why does my mother have to suffer like this? It feels like there's nothing I can do to help her, no matter how hard I try."
8. Event: No one to help with caring for sick father
IAS Post: "It's not fair that I have to shoulder all of this alone. Why can't anyone else step up and support me? It feels like I'm carrying the whole weight of the world on my own."
9. Event: Oldest brother having heart problems
IAS Post: "Why does he get to be healthy and happy, while I have to deal with all of this crap? It feels like life is so unfair."
10. Event: Middle brother not showing interest in family affairs
IAS Post: "Why can't he just care about me for once? Doesn't he know how much I need him right now?"
11. Event: Feeling overwhelmed and unable to handle life
IAS Post: "I feel like I'm drowning in this sea of responsibilities and problems. Why can't I just catch my breath for a second?"
12. Event: Having suicidal thoughts and feelings
IAS Post: "Why do these feelings have to consume me? Why can't I just be happy and content, without always feeling like there's a knife in my chest."

Event: My mom has fallen into depression due to a choice I made involving who I want to spend my life with, which has hit her hard (girl from different culture).
Post: "As if dealing with cultural differences wasn't enough, now I have to watch my mom struggle with depression because of my choices. It's like, I get it, I made a decision, but can't she see how much love I have for her? Why does it have to be so hard on her?"

Event: ... Failing classes, taking a fall semester off, feeling depressed, isolating oneself, and being made fun of by a competitive friend.
Post: "Maybe I'm just not cut out for college. Every time I try to keep up, I end up falling behind. Taking a semester off might be just what I need to figure out my struggles."

Event: You promised to never leave me, yet you left me.
Post: "Despite my best efforts to hold on, you abandoned me when I needed you most."

Event: My husband was diagnosed with depression and anxiety, he hardly knows life without depression, he's not suicidal or super moody but he's not living life to the fullest either, he's just there, he's been unemployed for few months, he's hoping to get into bookkeeping, luckily they get by just fine on my income alone, I want him to find a career or something fulfilling to do outside of the home, he's not putting in sufficient effort to get a job in a timely manner, he's constantly drained, I'm trying my best to be patient and non-judgmental but I have a hard time telling if it's his own dang fault or depression that he can't help, I fear bringing this up with him too often for fear of making him feel even worse about himself, how do you know or judge what is an acceptable level of functioning and what's unacceptable (and calls for a prescription change, therapy, etc)
Post: "Despite his best efforts, my husband seems stuck in a rut with depression and anxiety. He's not suicidal or overly moody, but he's not living life to the fullest either. It's like he's just existing, rather than truly being present. I want him to find a fulfilling career or hobby outside of the home, but he's not putting in sufficient effort to get a job in a timely manner. I'm trying my best to be patient and non-judgmental, but it's hard not to feel frustrated when he's not taking steps towards recovery. I fear bringing this up with him too often for fear of making him feel worse about himself, but at the same time, I want him to know that I'm here to support him and help him get better."

It's a lonely feeling, being stuck in this vicious cycle of self-criticism and isolation."

Event:

Event: Feeling lonely and depressed due to a girl being liked, despite always being extroverted with many friends to call and hang out with, feeling bad about one's appearance leading to self-consciousness and fear of rejection when expressing feelings, and struggling to handle the situation at work while still having to interact with the person.

Work has become a nightmare as I struggle to focus, knowing that I have to interact with her every day. I can't help but wonder if there's something wrong with me, and the fear of rejection haunts me at every turn."

Event: Feeling anxious and depressed due to struggling to find a job after returning home, feeling useless and losing one's place to live, being told by one's father that they are a loser, and having no support from friends or loved ones.

Event: The main event in this text is the individual's feelings of depression, emptiness, and inadequacy, as well as their desire to be happy and their dependence on a particular girl for emotional fulfillment. These events are negative and have a bad effect from the individual's point of view.

Event:
The main event in this story is the narrator's relationship with a girl who had a history of being disrespectful, mean, and cynical towards everything. The narrator tried to help her improve her behavior, but she eventually reverted back to her old ways after going back to school. The narrator was emotionally hurt by her behavior and struggled to cope with it, leading to a break-up.

The event can be classified as a negative experience for the narrator, as it caused emotional distress and affected his work, lifestyle, and overall well-being. The event also highlights the importance of mutual respect and empathy in a relationship, as the narrator was unable to get through to the girl despite his best efforts.
Post: "It's like she reverted back to her old ways as soon as she went back to school. I invested so much time and effort into trying to help her change, but it was all for nothing. It's disheartening to see her return to her mean-spirited behavior, especially after everything we shared. I can't keep feeling emotionally drained by her actions, so it's best we part ways."

Event: The main event in this sentence is "I feel like I'm a broken record trying to make you believe what I'm saying, yet the broken pieces are cutting me." This event is described as a negative experience for the speaker, who feels like they are repeatedly trying to convey something to someone else without any success or relief.
Post: "Feeling like a needle stuck in a groove, I'm constantly repeating myself with no break in sight... it's like my words are bouncing off a wall of disbelief."

Event:
I was feeling angry at people for going against what I believed to be my personal and innate way of living, but now I am not sure. Today at school my teacher said "how are you" to me and this girl who had been bothering me for a long time, who I would get angry at but I had never talked to, who seemed to keep smiling at me and looking at me subtly as I would also look at her because I wanted to know what was going on, turned around slightly when she heard that and probably smiled.

Note: The event is the interaction between the writer and their teacher and a girl they had been feeling angry towards.
Post: "Despite my efforts to assert my personal way of living, I'm still unsure if it's truly innate. Today at school, my teacher asked me how I was, and that girl who had been bothering me for so long suddenly smiled when she heard the question... Maybe there's more to life than just following my instincts?"
